mvdatasets.utils.images.image_to_numpy(pil_image, use_lower_left_origin=False, use_uint8=False)

Convert a PIL Image to a numpy array. If use_uint8 is False, the values are in [0, 1] and the dtype is float32. If use_uint8 is True, the values are in [0, 255] and the dtype is uint8.

mvdatasets.utils.images.image_to_tensor(pil_image, device='cpu')

Convert a PIL Image to a torch tensor with values in 0 and 1.

mvdatasets.utils.images.image_uint8_to_float32(tensor)

converts uint8 tensor to float32

mvdatasets.utils.point_clouds module

mvdatasets.utils.point_clouds.load_point_cloud(point_cloud_path, max_nr_points=None, verbose=False)

Loads point cloud from file. If the file is a mesh, points are its vertices.

Parameters:

  • point_cloud_path – point cloud file path

  • max_nr_points – maximum number of points to load

Returns:

numpy array

Return type:

points_3d (N, 3)

mvdatasets.utils.point_clouds.load_point_clouds(point_clouds_paths, max_nr_points=10000, verbose=False)

Loads point cloud from files. If the file is a mesh, points are its vertices.

Parameters:

  • point_clouds_paths – ordered list of point cloud file paths

  • max_nr_points – maximum number of points to load

Returns:

ordered list of (N, 3) numpy arrays

mvdatasets.utils.printing.print_error(message, exc_type=None, exc_value=None, exc_traceback=None, terminate=True)

Print a detailed error message with a stack trace.

Parameters:

  • message – The error message to display.

  • exc_type – The type of the exception (optional).

  • exc_value – The value of the exception (optional).

  • exc_traceback – The traceback object (optional).

  • terminate – Whether to terminate the execution by raising an exception (default: True).

mvdatasets.utils.profiler module

class mvdatasets.utils.profiler.Profiler(verbose=False)

Bases: object

Profiler class to measure time of different parts of the code.

end(name)

Ends a timer with the given name, updates the history.

get_avg_time(name)

Returns the average time for the given timer.

get_last_time(name)

Returns the last time for the given timer.

print_avg_times()

Prints the average time for each timer. Thread timers are averaged over all threads.

reset()

Resets the profiler.

start(name)

Starts a timer with the given name.

mvdatasets.utils.raycasting module

mvdatasets.utils.raycasting.get_data_per_pixels(pixels: Tensor, cameras_idx: Tensor | ndarray | None = None, frames_idx: Tensor | ndarray | None = None, data_dict: dict = {}, verbose: bool = False)

given a list of pixels and a list of frames, return rgb and mask values at pixels

Parameters:

  • pixels (torch.Tensor, int32) – (N, 2) with values in [0, W-1], [0, H-1]

  • cameras_idx (optional, torch.Tensor, int) –

    1. camera indices

  • frames_idx (optional, torch.Tensor, int) –

    1. frame indices.

  • data_dict (dict, uint8) – rgbs (optional, torch.Tensor or np.array, uint8): (N, T, H, W, 3) or (H, W, 3) None masks (optional, torch.Tensor or np.array, uint8): (N, T, H, W, 1) or (H, W, 1) or None

Returns:

rgb (optional, torch.Tensor or np.array, float): (N, 3) mask (optional, torch.Tensor or np.array, float): (N, 1)

Return type:

vals (dict)

mvdatasets.utils.raycasting.get_data_per_points_2d_screen(points_2d_screen: Tensor, cameras_idx: Tensor | ndarray | None = None, frames_idx: Tensor | ndarray | None = None, data_dict: dict = {}, verbose: bool = False)

given a list of pixels and a list of frames, return rgb and mask values at pixels

Parameters:

  • points_2d_screen (torch.Tensor, float) – (N, 2) with values in [0, W-1], [0, H-1]

  • cameras_idx (optional, torch.Tensor or np.ndarray) –

    1. camera indices

  • frames_idx (optional, torch.Tensor or np.ndarray) –

    1. frame indices

  • data_dict (dict, uint8) – rgbs (torch.Tensor, uint8): (H, W, 3) mask (torch.Tensor, uint8): (H, W, 1)

Returns:

rgb (optional, torch.Tensor, float): (N, 3) mask (optional, torch.Tensor, float): (N, 1)

Return type:

vals (dict)

convert pixels to 2d points on the image plane

Parameters:

  • pixels (torch.Tensor) – (W, H, 2) or (N, 2) list of pixels

  • jitter_pixels (bool) – whether to jitter pixels

Returns:

(N, 2) list of pixels centers (in screen space)

Return type:

points_2d_screen (torch.Tensor)

mvdatasets.utils.raycasting.get_random_pixels(height: int, width: int, nr_pixels: int, device: str = 'cpu') → Tensor

given a number or pixels, return random pixels :param height: frame height :type height: int :param width: frame width :type width: int :param nr_pixels: number of pixels to sample :type nr_pixels: int :param device: Defaults to “cpu”. :type device: str, optional

Returns:

(N, 2) with values in [0, W-1], [0, H-1]

Return type:

pixels (torch.Tensor, int)

mvdatasets.utils.raycasting.get_random_pixels_from_error_map(error_map: Tensor, nr_pixels: int, device: str = 'cpu') → Tensor

given a number of pixels and an error map, sample pixels with error map as probability

Parameters:

  • error_map (torch.Tensor) – (H, W, 1) with values in [0, 1]

  • height (int) – frame height

  • width (int) – frame width

  • nr_pixels (int) – number of pixels to sample

  • device (str, optional) – Defaults to “cpu”.

mvdatasets.utils.raycasting.get_rays_per_points_2d_screen(c2w: Tensor, intrinsics_inv: Tensor, points_2d_screen: Tensor) → Tuple[Tensor, Tensor]

given a list of pixels, return rays origins and directions

Parameters:

  • c2w (torch.Tensor) – (N, 4, 4) or (4, 4)

  • intrinsics_inv (torch.Tensor) – (N, 3, 3) or (3, 3)

  • points_2d_screen (torch.Tensor, float) – (N, 2) with values in [0, W-1], [0, H-1]

Returns:

(N, 3) rays_d (torch.Tensor): (N, 3)

Return type:

rays_o (torch.Tensor)
